China says threats of force over Taiwan not aimed at most TaiwaneseChina's position that it will not renounce using force to bring Taiwan under its control is aimed at foreign interference and a tiny number of separatists, but Taiwanese need to be disabused of "biases" against China, the government said on Wednesday. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:22:51 GMT GHTWF4TP5FMBDCDEXPP3SZYKHI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-says-threats-force-over-taiwan-not-aimed-most-taiwanese-2024-01-17/Reuters世界亚太地区
Cold wave in north India disrupts flights for fourth dayA cold wave bringing dense fog this week to parts of northern India disrupted flights for a fourth straight day on Wednesday, delaying more than 100 and forcing cancellations of about 20. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:14:00 GMT 47NOTYGFNZMFJFK4DIOGG6IXBQ https://www.reuters.com/world/india/cold-wave-north-india-disrupts-flights-fourth-day-2024-01-17/Reuters世界印度
China helps Pacific Islands with policing, not defence - ambassadorChina has a strategy to help Pacific Island nations with policing, not defence, and its growing presence in the region should not alarm Australia, China's ambassador to Australia said on Wednesday. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:03:19 GMT 7DDJ7HCVQBNGVAFHIDU2KWPU3A https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-helps-pacific-islands-with-policing-not-defence-ambassador-2024-01-17/Kirsty Needham世界亚太地区
Malaysia to review migrant labour deals to stamp out exploitationMalaysia will review bilateral agreements with 15 nations from which it sources labourers in a bid to address exploitative practices and manpower imbalances that have left thousands of migrant workers stranded without jobs, officials said. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 02:32:00 GMT PMACDFLQCJOKFGM36LBT7H7DGY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/malaysia-review-migrant-labour-deals-stamp-out-exploitation-2024-01-17/Reuters世界亚太地区
China's population drops for 2nd year, raises long-term growth concernsChina's population fell for a second consecutive year in 2023, as a record low birth rate and a wave of COVID-19 deaths when strict lockdowns ended accelerated a downturn that will have profound long-term effects on the economy's growth potential. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 02:04:41 GMT TVFZSLJ2A5NH5NULVBHYWYPMGY https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-population-drops-2nd-year-raises-long-term-growth-concerns-2024-01-17/Farah Master世界中国
CPKC, other rail operators send proposals for passenger transport on Mexican railwaysMexico's Transport Ministry said on Tuesday it received five proposals from interested parties to participate in the roll-out of a project to boost passenger transport on railways being developed across the country. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:19:43 GMT 2PT6JVM3FZOTBNO45ZPP5PLHBI https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexico-receives- Five-proposals-develop-passenger-transport-railways-2024-01-17/Reuters世界美洲
South Korea imposes sanctions linked to North Korea weapon developmentSouth Korea has sanctioned two individuals, three entities and 11 ships linked to North Korea's nuclear and missile programmes, its foreign ministry said on Wednesday. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:18:21 GMT QQPBNFKLPNP65A4U5Y2VOPSP6M https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-korea-imposes-sanctions-linked-north-korea-weapon-development-2024-01-17/Hyonhee Shin世界亚太地区
China to support Togo in safeguarding its sovereignty, security -Wang YiChina will continue to firmly support Togo in safeguarding its sovereignty, security and development interests, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said while visiting the African country, according to a ministry statement on Wednesday. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:16:16 GMT E6ZVQWPZ6FLF7OQSWZX776U7G4 https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-support-togo-safeguarding-its-sovereignty-security-wang-yi-2024-01-17/Reuters世界亚太地区
Exclusive: Canada minister says study permits to students from India drop due to disputeThe number of permits issued is unlikely to rebound soon, the immigration minister told Reuters. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:06:13 GMT TK6VCHF5KVLYJEGMQDW3BHAGGE https://www.reuters.com/world/canada-minister-says-study-permits-students-india-drop-due-dispute-2024-01-17/Steve Scherer世界
US Senate rejects measure to force human rights report on IsraelThe U.S. Senate rejected a resolution on Tuesday that would have frozen security aid to Israel unless the State Department produces a report within 30 days examining whether Israel committed human rights violations in its campaign against Hamas in Gaza. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 00:51:47 GMT QYHUR7VQYNIZDETB5OW7JYOWVQ https://www.reuters.com/world/senate-rejects-measure-force- human-rights-report-israel-2024-01-17/Patricia Zengerle世界
UK PM Sunak's authority faces test in showdown over Rwanda asylum planBritish Prime Minister Rishi Sunak faces a major parliamentary showdown on Wednesday over his plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda, with many of his own lawmakers threatening to rebel after they lost an initial bid to toughen his proposed law. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 00:11:28 GMT AHY2C3X64JJZZGAKMN3BXJBFUU https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/uk-pm-sunaks-authority-faces-test-showdown-over-rwanda-asylum-plan-2024-01-17/Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper世界英国
